website_summaries.verdict: The quality Cuisinart offers in other appliances shows up in this wide mouth toaster.
pros: Comes with a defrost and reheat button
Toaster can handle 4 pieces of bread at a time with 2 separate controls for toast level
The lift goes high enough to handle short pieces of bread
Does a good job of toasting without drying out the bread
cons: Wider, but not longer than a normal toaster slot

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed in this toaster. Even on the highest setting it does not really "toast", it just makes warm bread. I like my toast a bit dark and I have to go through two cycles at the #4 setting (of 5) to get it brown. Why does it seem the most expensive, name brand toasters are the worst?
customer_reviews.author: Jackie W.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy I purchase this toaster
customer_reviews.text: It replaced one that quit browning. We like darker toast, and this new one has up to #6 on settings. One can insert frozen bread for there is a selection to indicated you are using frozen bread. A big thing for me, is that when the lever is depressed to begin toasting, it is securely in place. Some toasters in the past would release and have to be re-pressed. When the toast is done, a definte click can be heard. The lever can be raised slightly to retrieve toast that is shallower. Sound like an ad, but I am so happy with something we use daily.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Piper

customer_reviews.title: It's working today
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't. it is very quirky and there are times that it does not allow me to push the toast down ... Right now it is working but if I were to buy another I wouldn't get a Cuisinart....
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G

customer_reviews.title: I did a ridiculous amount of research
customer_reviews.text: Because this is about my sixth toaster, albeit half of those were from goodwill or yardsales, and I was ready to be done buying toasters. [fingers crossed] I can confirm that this one does an excellent job, evenly toasted on both sides and dark as I want, while still soft on the inside—so, no “melba toast” effect where the whole slice becomes a dry plank. (Like when you make toast in a toaster oven.) There’s a very similar Cuisinart model at Costco that I almost bought, but prefer the rotary knobs and also this one takes up a little less space because the levers aren’t “frenched in” by moving the whole surface outward.
customer_reviews.author: KZ

customer_reviews.title: Returned After First Use
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing, particularly since it is an "Amazon's Choice". All four slots worked very unevenly. On its highest setting it just browned a piece of white bread on one side, and dried out the other side without browning. Maybe you'll get a good one, but if you don't want to risk wasting your time look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Agillator

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This toaster worked well for 2 years. The only complaint through 2 years was that the lettering on the buttons rubbed off. You would think that a big company like Cuisinart could do enough research to print some text on buttons that would not rub off. That is the good news portion of this review. The bad news is that after 2 years the left two toaster slots will not stay down anymore. What is so hard about producing a toaster that works???? This product is warranted for 3 years. Will update review after contacting customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Billp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and stylish looking
customer_reviews.text: Stylish looking toaster. This is easy to use and toasts evenly. There are separate controls for the right and left sides (you can adjust temperature and choose from bagel, defrost, reheat and cancel). This dead’s well with thick home made bread as well as store bought slides bread.
customer_reviews.author: Tori P.

customer_reviews.title: What's so special
customer_reviews.text: Well I don't know what is so special about this particular brand compared to all the other toasters out there that look exactly like it. Probably will never know because I bought this one instead of the others there are several out there that look just like this one so to be able to say which one is really better you would have to buy them all. It seems to work like any other toaster you put the toast in there push the button down and it toast bread big deal but it's more expensive than any of the others because of the name I would guess that's why I'm giving it mostly just three stars
customer_reviews.author: Raptor4

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this toaster.
customer_reviews.text: In one slice mode this is so slow that the bread is baked dry and hard before it toasts. In the 2cd slot from right one can see that one side is much hotter than the other. The only way I found to make toast is to put 2 slices together, toast 1 side then the other. This workd in 2cd slot from left, except that sometimes one side is nicely toasted while the other is almost untouched. Overall this is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Socalede

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and works well!
customer_reviews.text: This toaster matches my decor and it works well. When the toast pops up, it is louder and not as solid sounding as my ancient Toastmaster was. That doesn't affect its function, but it's just an observation about the perceived quality. The only thing I don't like about this toaster is that the adjustment knobs turn way too easily. It would feel much better if there was more resistance, or even indents or 'clicks' for the settings. The lack of resistance for the dials adjustment settings makes an otherwise nice product feel cheap. Also, don't forget to take the cardboard out of the slot before you use it for the first time!
customer_reviews.author: Peter H.

customer_reviews.title: Blah!
customer_reviews.text: Sorry I kept it. Forgot that we use a lot of breads that have elongated large slices. With this type toaster they don't fit in you have to trim the bread to fit in and waste 10 to 20% of a slice. It also has a very touchy light / dark control . Set it at 3 and not toasted enough for me. Set it at 3-1/2 and it turns toast to charcoal ! Should have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: MIKEY 650i

customer_reviews.title: Buy with peace of mind.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Works perfectly. Once you find the number that makes toast browned the way you like it, you’re all set! Works great on bagels! Have had for many months now and use almost daily so it has had the opportunity to show off any quirks and I’m glad to say, there are none. The 4 slice feature is life saver when making for quantities of toast or bagels. I researched toasters extensively and based on reviews, I went with this one. Have not been sorry for one minute. Buy with peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kyla Petit

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster. I had used our old toaster for so long, I had forgotten what it was like to have actual toast. It was either under toasted, or burned. This toaster is perfect and gives me a perfectly toasted piece every time. The dials make it easily adjustable and the buttons are easy to figure out. The appearance is nice and it doesn't take up too much room on the counter. Overall, don't be afraid to buy this one. It works well.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: A lttle dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: After all the great reviews, I was genuinely surprised by the lousy job this thing does on bagels, and not that great a job on toast. It cooks very hot and fast. So fast that medium toast will be medium brown, but still mushy soft. Some may like that...I don't. The real issue though is how uneven it toasts. It will always be far lighter at the top than at the bottom. It seems worse on bagels than toast. The only way to toast really evenly is to stop halfway through and turn them top to bottom. Probably should have just sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Magnum Bob

customer_reviews.title: Could be dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time i have sent a product back to Amazon. This toaster became unbelievably hot on both sides, at the back and of course on the top. The heat was enough to cause burns on fingers. I do not know if this one had a defect or they are all like this now. I already had this make and very similar model from years back and never had any problems with it hence why i was buying the same again. However this one was much lighter and gave off a dangerous heat.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Ray

customer_reviews.title: A little tricky
customer_reviews.text: The toaster works well but it is a little tricky. On occasions you press the the lever down for it to start toasting but it does not stay down. I found that you need to be a bit forceful. Also there are many buttons on the toaster, for warming or defrosting, useful features for some. It does toast well but one needs to experiment for which setting is best for which bread as some breads are denser than others.
customer_reviews.author: MandBinc

customer_reviews.title: Burns toast.  Settings are inaccurate.
customer_reviews.text: This product did not meet my standards. It toasts unevenly, which usually means it burns. Even though there are several toasting settings, I had to toast bread on 1.5 for two rounds to keep it from burning. I bought this toaster because I wanted one in stainless steel. Although I had an old white cuisinart toaster (4 slots) that worked perfectly, the stainless steel did not perform the same way. I’n throwing the stainless steel away and going back to my old one white one. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Clow

customer_reviews.title: Not cuisinart quality.
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart usually makes very good products, but this toaster is something you would expect from an off-brand company. It is very uneven and the toast level settings almost seem meaningless. The bagel setting doesn't seem to change anything really, it might slightly reduce power on one side of slot but it you couldn't tell by looking at it. Waffles have to be rotated and flipped between the two cycles it takes to cook them to the level I like. The toaster looks nice but everything about it feels cheaply made. We kept it just because its a toaster, and it's not worth returning, but we would definitely not purchase it again had we known the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Almost paradise
customer_reviews.text: Why the slots aren't an inch longer, I don't know. I'd be very very happy with this toaster if that were the case, instead I live in fear that I'll find a favorite bread and it won't fit. My current sandwich bread barely fits as it is. Other than that, I love it. It toasts quick;y and evenly enough. The levers are fine. People say they're poorly made and I did not find that to be the case. They seem a tad clunky, but durable. The toasting is also quick. Our last toaster took FOREVER and this one is nice and normal so we're keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart throughout
customer_reviews.text: Have Cuisinart throughout my entire kitchen. Have been pretty please with performance and quality of most products. I originally had a Cuisinart toaster oven that just took up too much space and wanted the convenience of a toaster and ideally faster speed. Both my toaster oven and this toaster tend to need to be set at a low setting otherwise the bread, bagel, etc. easily gets burned. It's been fast. Nice construction and design. However slots have been not as wide as I had hoped. When toasting only 1 side, it seems to toast unevenly, though it may be my imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Hesed2020

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working for a 2nd time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster twice since I like how it looks. The first time it lasted just over 2 years and then died. I figured that wasn't too bad, so I bought a new one. This one only lasted 7 months. One side works fine. But the other side doesn't (if you toast anything on the lowest setting it still gets burnt). So, unfortunately I have to give this 1 star...I don't think a toaster has to last 10 years, but it clearly shouldn't die so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: DaveLavNY

customer_reviews.title: Finally a toaster that toasts evenly!
customer_reviews.text: Had a cheap S..B..m that finally gave up the ghost and needed a replacement. Searched reviews ad-noisome and finally decided to go with this Cuisinart. Glad I did as it does toast store type bread very evenly. The only thing I wish it did was toast only on one side for the bagel setting. I don't eat bagels but it would be great when grilling hamburgers and toasting only the inside of the bun. Oh well, small gripe for what appears to be an awesome toaster! If it lasts, I'm an eternal fan; if not, then I will repost and let you know. But for now, just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: B Derringer

customer_reviews.title: Great value toaster.
customer_reviews.text: We had to replace our 15+ year old toaster that had stuck with daily breakfasts for a family of six! It was a sad day, like saying goodbye to a dear friend. We read reviews and while we contemplated spending big $$ on an important part of our kitchen ensemble, we decidedly to take a chance on this value-prices contender. Two months in, and we love it. Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, performs well
customer_reviews.text: After 10 plus years our toaster died and we needed a new one. This one has the best reviews on Amazon. I think it looks very sharp in the jitchen. It performs well too. You do have to push the lever down until it clicks to cook something which we didn't realize at first and my hubby thought it didn't work. It cooks even and well and when you want to stop in the middle of cool time the cancel button works just fine. I like that it cooks 4 items at once and that it works good.
customer_reviews.author: mrsmel269Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time we bought this toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd time we purchased this toaster. After using the toaster for a long time, one side of the toaster stopped working. We liked the toaster so much that we decided that we would get the same toaster again!
customer_reviews.author: maureendrews

customer_reviews.title: attractive and durable
customer_reviews.text: They don't make toasters like they used to, but this one has lasted us a good long while. The stainless remains stainless. The browning remains even. The two sides of the toaster (each with its own thermostatic control) remains synchronous, meaning that each side browns at the same rate and if set at the same level, pops at the same time. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: Magnificent Spatulatail

customer_reviews.title: Toasts Evenly, Beautiful Design
customer_reviews.text: Very nice toaster and I have been through quite a few before this. When I set out to buy a new one I was highly skeptical and wondered if anyone out there was even trying to make a decent toaster anymore. I read all the reviews very carefully, and this one sounded the best. Sure enough, it toasts evenly--which you'd hope all toasters do, but they don't--and it is simple with a nice design. I don't really know what else to say about it other than that it does its job.
customer_reviews.author: MR-LR

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Does not toast bread evenly, a setting of 6 is required for a regular Thomas muffin to barely toast it sounds very tinny when being used. This product does not meet up to previous Cuisinart standards. It almost feels like it it a knockoff. I will not recommend nor buy a Cuisinart product of any kind again.
customer_reviews.author: ArtistElaine

customer_reviews.title: Toasts great looks beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The toaster is really good looking and roasts pretty well. I use it for bread and bagels and I’ve gotten great toasting results to be honest. The only con to this is that you have to push the lever down really hard like u wanna break it in order for it to actually stay down and toast otherwise you’ll think it’s broken like a lot of other people on here lol.
customer_reviews.author: Cloud

customer_reviews.title: It works as it should!
customer_reviews.text: Our toaster died after many, many years of daily use. We went through 5 new toasters and they all kept burning our toast and waffles even in the lowest setting. Not sure why. This day in age our toasters really should be more reliable and durable. We have used this toaster for about a week and the settings work as they should. Only four stars as I think the levers could feel better manufactured and the look could be much more beautiful and sturdy for the price. But it works for now and we are tired of buying and returning other toasters. Hopefully we will keep this one for a while.
customer_reviews.author: ACVA

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for about a week.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this toaster specifically because it described toasting bagels correctly. It worked perfect for about a week toasting only one side when the bagel button was engaged. Then, all of a sudden, it started toasting both sides and there was nothing that could be done about the malfunction. I'm greatly disappointed in the fact that I did an extensive search to identify what I expected to be the perfect toaster, I later found out I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa B, Chas WV

customer_reviews.title: Makes very even toast and bagels
customer_reviews.text: So far this has turned out to be a very good toaster. The bagel setting works as it should and it does a really nice job of heating/toasting evenly and the adjustment knob doesn't seem to have any odd "jumps" in consistency; medium is medium, light is light, etc. The unit is also pretty solidly built; no rattling bits when you put it away, and it's got some heft to it. Really pleased with it so far after about 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Nick J.

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: We got this when our old toaster of a different make died on us. Once again Cuisinart didn't let us down. It get very regular use and we haven't had any problem. The cooking results have been uniform and repeatable we also love the reheat feature so when we get side tracked we can reheat and not burn our toast. Would buy again if we break out current one. I say if "we break it" because its made well and I for see many years of service to come.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Cheap toaster
customer_reviews.text: This toaster looks and feels cheap! I’m surprised it’s a cuisanart!!! I’m thinking it might not be. The controls and levers rattle and just feel cheap! Don’t buy!!!! The bread toasts unevenly and it never comes out the same consistency.
customer_reviews.author: K. Shuster

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster, but not great
customer_reviews.text: Nice toaster, but it doesn't toast evenly. I've tried bagels, bread and english muffins and half is burned (top or bottom half, not sure) while the other half is done normal or a little under done. Still working with the settings, it might just be me. But even so, I wouldn't think a toaster should take much figuring out. LoL.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 20 months before it began smoking
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty happy with the toaster until this week when it began spewing horrible electrical smoke from one side. No, it wasn't crumbs burning. It was something deeply wrong with the machine. Makes me ill that crap we are all drowning in these days. Toasters used to last decades. Oh, well, I'll try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Trumbo123

customer_reviews.title: It’s a toaster. Does the job. Last one was reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I had one before and this is the replacement. It’s a toaster. It does the job OK. Has several settings. The temperature dial is not that finely calibrated but you can turn it up and down. It is not that easy to clean out. It has shallow trays that are more decorative than functional. We just turn it upside down now and then and shake out the crumbs. Our last one lasted for years so our expectation is that this will hold up pretty well. Only been a few months. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Misquit

customer_reviews.title: Bagel setting just adds more time - toasts both sides;
customer_reviews.text: The toaster is nice looking. Toasting one piece of bread (indicates to use the right most slot) results in very inconsistent toasting (varies from burned to not toasted with the same bread). The bagel setting toasts both sides of the bagel just adds time to the toasting. The instruction booklet indicates this is how it is made to work - contrary to the description for this listing.
customer_reviews.author: SeeBears

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster.
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster! Just bought to replace a Sunbeam I had for 3 years. Very impressed with this toaster. Buttons and levers are much sturdier and appears much more stable and well made. The only thing I failed to realize when purchasing was the lack of a retractable cord. I would have preferred that, but I can live without it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: Glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months of use, I'm very pleased. Toast and bagels are consistently nice. The defrost setting works well for bread straight from the freezer. It takes a bit more strength than my previous toaster to fully depress the toaster lever, but I quickly got accustomed to this. I'd love it if the crumb trays opened from the front as they would be even easier to clean if they did.
customer_reviews.author: Joan L

customer_reviews.title: what's new
customer_reviews.text: quality seems to be something i experienced as a child, i am 54 years old and as much as i study other's reviews, i still can't find quality like it once was in the past. The toast comes out brown on 1 side and not on the other, other than that if you want to look at something shiny and pretty this is for you, want a toaster that does it's job, this sucks
customer_reviews.author: john cox

customer_reviews.title: Horrible and horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Product lasted less then 2 months and then started to burn on one side of the toaster so only half is usable. I wouldn’t recommend this product. I have tried contacting the seller to replace but have not gotten a response
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: The excellent reviews that this machine has gathered are absolutely justified. It is easy to use, it toasts bagels and bread very evenly, and it functions flawlessly. I also like the sleek look. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Austin

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster but...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this toaster because the description said it has one sided toasting (for bagels or hamburger buns) Got it quickly, and it is a very nice looking and easy to use toaster but...it does not have onesided bagel toasting. It toast both sides of the bagel or bun. So now I have spent $60 on a toaster that does not do what the long description said it does. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: terralee

customer_reviews.title: Great design, quality brand.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like that the crumb trays are only accessible from the back, but it does give a sleeker look. Cuisinart is a great brand and I know this will last. For the people saying there’s a plastic smell, that’s normal. The coating on the metal needs to burn off. Ovens and toaster overs have a similar issue. Read your manuals or use and care. Sincerely an experienced appliance sales woman.
customer_reviews.author: a_dream

customer_reviews.title: Bagel toasts on both sides
customer_reviews.text: The bagel setting toasts for a longer period. It toasts BOTH sides of the bagel with equal heat. I wanted a toaster to toast the cut side of the bagel. Good toaster for the price. Shame on me for the assumption that all 'bagel' settings are created equal. Nothing to do with the toaster, but Amazon. For 10 days the Amazon feedback said the refund would be credited to my account. With NO notification at all the refund was applied to an Amazon gift card. Very unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: reader49

customer_reviews.title: Takes a long time to toast
customer_reviews.text: We have had this toaster since April and it gets used often. Pro: It’s an attractive toaster. It looks good on the counter top. Con: Toasting takes a long time. The knob, which controls the time the toast is down, does not seem to have any real value. Whether it is set on 2 or 6, the toast always needs a second push. I don’t think the bagel button really works either.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bentkofsky

customer_reviews.title: Died just over a year old
customer_reviews.text: Just stopped working one day. Plug it in, no lights and neither handle stays down. Gave it a good clean out and verified power, nothing. It just up and quit. I have plenty of Cuisinart appliances and I’ll never buy another toaster. My grandmother had a toaster last almost 25 years. This thing barely made it one. If you want a toaster that lasts, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: 5 1/2 months and it barely is functional.
customer_reviews.text: I have waited five months to review this product. (I purchased the product based solely upon prior purchasers reviews.) There are two adults in the household, and the toaster is used approx. 5 times per week (a.m. toast) Initially it worked fine. Now after having the product for less than 6 months the toaster filaments are weakening to the point that the bread is no longer properly toasted. (Warmed bread). Would I repurchase this toaster? NEVER!
customer_reviews.author: Pearlblue

customer_reviews.title: Defintely was shoddier than the previous version of the same model.
customer_reviews.text: I got this toaster as a replacement for a seemingly identical product which I bought several years ago and which eventually broke on one side. It looks the same on the outside, but the works inside feel light and shoddy when I push the handles. I think it is more cheaply-made compared to the earlier version. I don't think it will last many years. Now in April of 2019 this expensive, but shoddily constructed toaster is already broken--not toasting properly and had to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: I regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: The temperature control on this toaster is less reliable than the old one that it was supposed to replace. At the very lowest setting the bottom of the toast is burnt and the top is not really brown. The other side of the piece of toast is brown in the middle and the top is not really toasted. In the other slot the situation is about the same. The lower price should have been an indicator for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My daughter didn’t like how fancy it was but is ok with it now
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was intimidated at first because she was use to our old one but she adapted and likes this one too! My wife likes that it takes up less counter space then our last 4 slice toaster. Cleaning is never easy especially the inside but this seems a little better. Looks great and fits in with our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Not worth price
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the price! First thing I noticed was how cheap it feels when you pick it up. Doesn’t feel like good quality or durable. I don’t think it toasts very well either. When I toast waffles on level 6 the highest setting it is barely toasted. I have to put it back in. I had my previous toaster over 20 years and it finally broke. It was heavy and felt like it was made well. The settings and toasting worked so much better. I think the toaster is worth maybe $30
customer_reviews.author: Sarah E. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated in the morning!
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it tuns on and once in a great while it cooks English muffins correctly. However, it is probably the worst toaster I have ever owned. The toaster will only cook one side so it is necessary to flip the muffin over and hope it will be cooked evenly and/or not burned. It is necessary to adjust the toast numbers as none of them toast uniformly. The toaster cooks toast well but if you like English muffins the toaster is of no use. I have used this product for a few months and I am sorry I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen D. Hardgrave

customer_reviews.title: Not all coils work
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our prior Cuisinart 4-Slice Toaster (very similar model) with this one because our old toaster had coils that were no longer functioning. Straight out of the box, this one had coils doing the exact same thing! Consequently, parts of toast and waffles were not cooked while other sections burned. Cheap quality at this price point!
customer_reviews.author: Caree Newman

customer_reviews.title: Love the toaster, not the shipper!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best toaster we have ever had! It heats up very quickly and is super easy to use. Highly recommend it. What I am not happy with is how it was shipped. The shipper literally pulled it off a shelf, slapped a shipping label on the box and mailed it out. There was no other packaging to protect it from potential damage, only the box it came in. It was also a gift, so needless to say when it arrived it was very evident what was in the box. Thankfully there wasn't any damage.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Koop

customer_reviews.title: Chinese junk toaster
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t stand the cheap tinny noise it made when I operated it and also when it later popped up ( Chinese junk). I actually went out and removed my old Breville from the recycle bin and started using it again.
customer_reviews.author: sigma 7

customer_reviews.title: This works great!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our old toaster when our 11-year old daughter watched how to make a grilled cheese in the toaster on YouTube, then tried it in our toaster. We could not get all of the cheese out, and it was smoking every time we used it. Then we found this toaster. It works great! toasts very quickly, and evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Horlacher

customer_reviews.title: Loved it so much, I bought another when my kids destroyed the first one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this two years ago and have been quite pleased. The large slots fit bagels well and its toasted consistently. One of my kids "brilliantly" put plastic in it and destroyed it. I immediately went to Amazon to order a replacement. That's how much I liked it. I'm getting the white dials to save money the second time around, but I really liked the look of the stainless and black while I was able to have it.
customer_reviews.author: A Mother's Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Discrepancy between what the Bagel Button REALLY does. DOES NOT TOAST 1 SIDE ONLY!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the look, size and ease to clean. I was frustrated that the bagel button didn't change the heating elements rather added extra time for thicker breads. SO, this toaster DOES NOT toast only 1 side of a bagel or english muffin. After contacting the manufacturer and they said it should, sent me a replacement (that did the same and toasted both sides)...I ended up returning both and starting my research again.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Noel

customer_reviews.title: great toast
customer_reviews.text: four slices means that my wife and I can each have our own settings. Yay! Plus, the settings are accurate and the cancel button is handy.
customer_reviews.author: J Norman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect simple toaster, great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great simple toaster and I like simple. It's amazing how expensive some toasters are and all the features they have. This one is not overkill. I really don't need a countdown after all I'm just making toast not sending a spaceship to the moon. Toasts nice and even and looks nice on the counter. That's all I need in a toaster!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: but controls move too freely (no detent between settings 1 through 6) so knob moves too easily and needs to be checked each time
customer_reviews.text: Sorry I didn't buy the similar KitchenAid model instead. Works well, but controls move too freely (no detent between settings 1 through 6) so knob moves too easily and needs to be checked each time item is used. Stainless steel finish shows fingerprints and needs to be wiped down regularly. Crumb trays easy to remove and clean. Nevertheless, a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kleinfeldt

customer_reviews.title: Cheap knobs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toaster for the money. It seems to function properly and heats toast evenly. Additionally, the easy clean feature on the toaster (the ability to remove the crumb trays) is super helpful. The only aspect I find displeasing about the toaster are the cheaply made plastic knobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Does not toast both sides equally.
customer_reviews.text: You would think a toaster could be developed that actually 'toasts' before we the sheeple get tricked once again by their flashy advertisements. Per my wife this is the way it is among ALL $50 toasters. I would not listen to her advise - oops! She says to get a REAL toaster that will truly toast both sides equally you must pay upwards of $100 +. This is sad for such a simple appliance as it's not Rocket Science or is it?
customer_reviews.author: Claymore

customer_reviews.title: Produces a perfect toast
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best toaster I have ever used. To be honest this is an exact replacement for my last one that finally wore out. We (obviously) love toasted carbs and this 4 slot toaster is our little work horse. It is accurate to the number and we get the same toasted factor on BOTH sides of the bread, every time. As you know this is not the case with every toaster. Cuisinart got this right. There is also a 1 toast slot, not sure who uses that, which is available for a small portion.
customer_reviews.author: Kara V

customer_reviews.title: Simple sleek toaster
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Toaster! Simple to use and wide enough for an over size bagel! It's nothing fancy but that's what I wanted. JUST a clean sleek looking toaster. I do like the sides do NOT get very hot on the house of the machine as I am a moron and touch things I shouldnt 🤣 Oh and it toasts perfectly
customer_reviews.author: L N F

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t toast evenly at all!
customer_reviews.text: This has been disappointing purchase. This our secondCuisinart toaster after 10 years. The first gave us 9 plus great toasted bread and bagels. Thought as long as it is still being offered, why not. Not because it takes FOREVER to toast, period. Same name and model but NOT the same toaster.
customer_reviews.author: James G. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster EVER
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster. Love the ability to defrost things and still have them come out perfect. Really like the fact that it has an extra lift so I don't burn my fingers when pulling small items out. The controls are easy to use and very precise.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D.

customer_reviews.title: Expected more for what I paid
customer_reviews.text: We have had this toaster for just under 9 months. Worked great until about 2 weeks ago when it developed a short. We are able to use the left side, but if we use the right side it blows our breaker. I expected more for what I paid. Our old $10 toaster lasted 8 years - and was still working just fine when I decided to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1 Star. Dave’s Killer bread doesn’t fit!
customer_reviews.text: Thought it was kind of “tinny” feeling. Wasn’t going to write a review until today when I found out the hard way that Dave’s Killer Bread won’t fit without smooshing the bread a bit. Bummed.
customer_reviews.author: michael rogers

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: This is the third identical toaster I have bought. They don't last more than a couple of years, and each one gets tinnier and less even-toasting. It will probably be my last Cuisinart. I can get the same quality for three times less.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice to look at. Does not toast well. Have the dial turned up almost all the way and it still needs to go back down and doesn't toast evenly. I don't know what the bagel setting is for. On other toasters I have had, the bagel setting was for toasting the inside of the bagel only. This bagel setting toasts both sides. I tried using all the slots to be sure it wasn't just one side that was faulty but, they all are. I really wanted to like it but, it doesn't work well and is not worth any money.
customer_reviews.author: Maered

customer_reviews.title: Only toasts on one side.
customer_reviews.text: I usually love Cuisinart products, however this toaster is junk. It only toasts on one side. So to achieve both sides toasted, I had to flip the bread around and "retoast". I would return it but missed the return date by one day.
customer_reviews.author: It's Priscilla

customer_reviews.title: Good item.
customer_reviews.text: Good 4 slice toaster. Temperature control a little disappointing. The defrost setting doesn’t really measure up. The unit is sturdy and I don’t regret the purchase. The last Cuisinart toaster I had lasted almost 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: shnurse

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT BROWN/TOAST ON ALMOST HIGEST SETTING! #5 of 6. The toaster I threw away worked better. Very disappointed. Photo: Toaster set on 5 1/2 of 6, bread still barely toasted. Always requires a second round.
customer_reviews.author: W. B.

customer_reviews.title: The only one you ever need.
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use and always works, big enough slots for bagels, and can cook all your toast at once. We had this toaster for 5 years, the only reason that we need to purchase another one is it was dropped in the move, and got a huge dent on the side, but it still worked. I just replaced it for aesthetic reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster for the price.
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these for about eleven years. Finally, the most-used (right) side failed (it still could toast, but the handle on the right side would no longer stay down.) I looked inside and it appears they use electronic sensors on each side to tell the toaster to lock down the handles and start the timer(s). In this case, a mechanical lock-down would have been preferable as it would be very unlikely to fail. The replacement is the same model and we hope it also lasts at least as long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cuisinart toaster. My first one lasted over 12 years and had the same features as my new one. What I especially like about the Cuisinart is the slide out tray under the toaster that collects the crumbs which makes for easy cleaning. I also use my liquid air duster to blow out any loose crumbs that did not fall on the tray. Would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Mosier

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: When my daughter moved I to her own apartment, I gave her our old toaster. It was an older model of this one, that we'd probably had for close to 10 years. She dropped it on moving day. It still "kind of" worked according to her, but it sounded like a fire hazard to me. Since our other one had lasted so long, I bought this one for her to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Kbuck6

customer_reviews.title: Works fine after 2 weeks of light use
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems fine so far after 2 weeks. No complaints. Price was right and it does the job. The product seems a little flimsy mainly because of feel of the temperature knob and other buttons. The temperature knob is very approximate - but again I can't complain for the price we paid, it toasts bread OK (even if slightly unevenly).
customer_reviews.author: StevenC

customer_reviews.title: no longer toasts after less than 10 months
customer_reviews.text: It has always been a bit awkward to use, but this morning 10/4/20 it would only warm things even on very high setting. Purchased 11/25/19 and used only 3 or 4 times a month. NOT a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Gulfcoaster

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best toaster I have ever purchased. It has lasted the longest, looked the best, and overall been the best quality. The toasting is even no matter what I'm toasting, and the different settings have been super convenient to use, instead of trying to guess which setting will work best. Definitely recommend this product to anyone looking for a long lasting, quality toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart - Can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: What a beautiful looking toaster. The settings are super simple - lots of options and it works perfectly. The stainless steel shell is solid and easy to clean. Does exactly what you need a toaster to do. Slots are wide for thick slices and bagels.
customer_reviews.author: Kevlar702

customer_reviews.title: Makes great toast
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a splurge because we wanted a four slice. After using it we realized, “we’ve never had a good toaster before .” It is fast and browns perfectly on the desired setting. I think it was about $75 but I noticed some were much much more. Very pleased with this.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: Best toaster ever!
customer_reviews.text: I used to own the 2 slices toaster from Cusinart. After 7 years it was time of an upgrade. This toaster is Convenience and practical. I really Love everything from Cusinart!! Diversity of temperature and toast features. Durable and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: MomOf4

customer_reviews.title: Two Months Old!
customer_reviews.text: Product broke two months after purchase. Toast lever wont stay down. Amazon return window was one month so we are stuck with it.....Cuisinart had me on hold forever then told my to go to their website......not only is this toaster a piece of junk, we bought the exact same toaster at Macys in Chicago for our daughter for $24.00!!!!! We paid $68.00 for a broken one!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Works well, feels pretty substantial. Toasts fairly quickly and evenly. Maybe we think its better than it really is because we replaced an ancient light weight cheapo model. But this is nice and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Rf Foley

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly good toaster.
customer_reviews.text: It's toasts, which is all I wanted. It's a toaster. No problems, just have to toast a few more times to figure where I want the dual set. It does seem to toast pretty dark so I'm thinking 3 is the perfect setting for me. But I like the toaster, it works great And I like that the sides don't get hot.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Returning this item
customer_reviews.text: It looks like Cuisinart has sacrificed its quality control department. The little knobs on this toaster don't actually do anything. It doesn't seem that they're hooked up to anything. I don't recommend buying this item.
customer_reviews.author: Alcofribas Nasier

customer_reviews.title: Pure Junk
customer_reviews.text: For the money the performance is terrible. Touchy darkness control, settings that don't do anything. There are better toasters for significantly less money. I expected more from Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Thompson

customer_reviews.title: over priced/ poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Toasts too fast. Burns outside of muffin and bagel, leaving the inside doughy, no matter what setting. Should’ve bought the cheapest unit. It’s a shame appliances are made so cheaply, especially with the price tag they carry.
customer_reviews.author: Danpa

customer_reviews.title: It'll toast, but the features are useless
customer_reviews.text: We use ours to just toast things, the bagel function doesn't work (as MANY others have stated), and mine didn't seem to have a crumb tray as advertised. Overall it is way overpriced for what you actually get; if the features listed worked, or if the price was about $20, then I would give this more than 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: #landfill
customer_reviews.text: I had only had it for a month and the left side broke. It just stopped working. When you have 6 kids spend the night you just end up using your broiler after this breaks. Also, the slots are too deep. So you burn your fingers when you have to pick out the shorter slices near the ends of rustic breads & even english muffins. 1st world problems I know. But sad to send it to Goodwill after using only half of it for a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene K.

customer_reviews.title: It gets so hot on out side it is a hazard
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is dangerous. It gets so hot in the out side it could cause a fire. A very dangerous produce. I only opened it today. I am so glad I did not give it as a wedding present. I bought it for that in the first place. But the bride had too many gifts of toasters so glad. She did not get this one. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline Ann Patron

customer_reviews.title: Nice toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice four slice toaster which is easy to use. Thus far it has toasted maybe 20 waffles and about 80 bread slices in the time since it arrived and it performs well. This toaster represents a reasonable value.
customer_reviews.author: Signal_Ridge

customer_reviews.title: This is a good toaster. I have one at home and one ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good toaster. I have one at home and one at my office. The only complaint would be that the sides don't cook similarly, and by sides I mean each set of 2. They could both be turned to exactly the same number but one side may be more done than the other and they may pop at different times.
customer_reviews.author: C. Barber

customer_reviews.title: Four-slot Cuisinart Toaster
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift for my mother-in-law. It is tradition to have breakfast on Sundays in this household. Formerly, she had the two slot version of this; however, the four slot version has made meal time prompt and the toast is now perfectly crispy (Other unit had some wear and tear from use for the years).
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges!!
customer_reviews.text: Caution! The inside edges are sharp! I was taking it from the pantry to the kitchen. The easiest way of carrying it is putting one’s hand inside. I was sliced by the sharp edges of the sheet metal and ended up with stitches in my finger!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and functional
customer_reviews.text: Last one lasted us more than 10 years. One side finally died... so we ordered the exact same toaster again. Makes good toast. Love the bagel setting for bagels. Simple and reliable. Recommended. Only request - Cuisinart, please make replacement circuit boards available. Thermister blew out on one of the two boards in our toaster. I hate to toss away a complete toaster due to one cheap replaceable component on a circuit board!
customer_reviews.author: Mommason

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CPT-180P1 Metal Classic 4-Slice toaster, Brushed Stainless
product_meta.description: Cuisinart Metal Classic Toaster. Cuisinart's Metal Classic Toaster has a smooth brushed stainless housing with polished chrome and black accents. Its custom controls let you defrost and toast bagels and bread -- just the way you want them Press any of the four buttons, bagels, reheat, defrost and cancel, to fit your toasting needs. The browning control sets the desired toast color from light to dark, with six browning levels. Product Features Smooth brushed stainless housing with polished chrome and black accents Custom control: 6-setting browning dials, dual reheat, defrost and bagel buttons with LED indicators 1-1/2-inch wide toasting slots Extra-lift carriage lever Slide-out crumb tray Convenient cord wrap Instruction book Limited 3-year warranty Toasting Tips Toasting is a combination of cooking and drying of the bread. Therefore, differences in moisture level from one bread to another can result in varying toasting times. For slightly dry bread, use a lower setting than you normally would. For very fresh bread or whole wheat bread, use a higher setting than normal. Breads with very uneven surfaces (such as English muffins) will require a higher toast setting. Thickly cut pieces of bread (including bagels) will take longer to toast, sometimes significantly longer, since more moisture must be evaporated from the bread before toasting can occur. Very thick pieces may require two cycles. Cleaning and Maintenance Always allow the toaster to cool completely before cleaning. Do not use abrasive cleansers. Simply wipe the exterior with a clean damp cloth and dry thoroughly. Apply any cleansing agent to a cloth, not to the toaster, before cleaning. To remove crumbs, slide out the crumb tray and discard crumbs. Wipe clean and replace. Never operate the toaster without the crumb tray in place. To remove any pieces of bread remaining in the toaster, turn the toaster upside down and gently shake. Never insert any hard or sharp instruments into the slot, as this could damage the toaster and cause a safety hazard. Never wrap the cord around the outside of the toaster. Use the cord storage cleats on the underside of the toaster. Product Dimensions The Cuisinart 2-Slice Metal Classic Toaster measures approximately 10.75" x 7.13" x 7.13". The 4-Slice Metal Classic Toaster measures approximately 11.15" x 10.65" x 7.5". Warranty The Cuisinart Metal Classic Toaster has a limited 3-year warranty. Do not touch hot surfaces. Use handles or knobs
feature_bullets: Dual control panels make this two toasters in one with smooth Brushed Stainless housing
Custom control: 6-setting browning dials, dual reheat, defrost and bagel buttons with LED indicators
1-1/2 inch - wide toasting slots, Extra-lift carriage lever, slide-out crumb tray and convenient cord storage
Actual unit dimensions: 11. 15" L x10. 65" W x7. 5" H

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,657 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
